verse: Allegory of the Boiling Pot. In the ninth year, on the tenth day of the tenth month, this word of the Lord came to me:
Son of man, write down the date of this day. For the king of Babylon has laid siege to Jerusalem this very day.
Therefore, propose this parable to this tribe of rebels and say to them: Thus says the Lord God:
Therefore, thus says the Lord God:
Therefore, thus says the Lord God:

I, the Lord, have spoken. The time is coming, and I will take action. I will not refrain, nor will I spare, nor will I relent. You will be judged by your conduct and by what you have done, says the Lord God.
Death of Ezekiel’s Wife. This word of the Lord was addressed to me:
Son of man, with a single blow I am about to take away from you the delight of your eyes. However, you are not to lament or weep or shed any tears.
Groan in silence, and do not mourn for the dead. Wrap your turban around your head, and put sandals on your feet. Do not cover your beard or eat the bread of mourners.
Therefore, I spoke to the people in the morning; in the evening my wife died. And on the following morning I did as I had been commanded.
Thereupon, the people said to me, “Will you not explain to us what all these things you are doing mean for us?”
Then I said to them: This is what the Lord God said to me,

“Say to the house of Israel: Thus says the Lord God: I am prepared to desecrate my sanctuary, the stronghold in which you take such pride, the delight of your eyes, and the desire of your heart. Your sons and your daughters whom you have left behind will fall by the sword.
“Then you shall do as I have done. You shall not cover your upper lip or eat the bread of mourners.
Your turbans shall remain on your heads and your sandals on your feet. You shall not mourn or weep. Further, you will waste away because of your iniquities and groan to one another.
Thus, Ezekiel will be a sign for you; you shall do just as he has done. When this occurs, then you will know that I am the Lord God.”

End of Ezekiel’s Muteness. As for you, son of man, on the day when I take from them their stronghold, their crowning joy, the delight of their eyes, the joy of their hearts, as well as their sons and daughters,
on that day, a fugitive will come and report this news to you.
On that day, your mouth will be opened and you shall no longer be mute. Thus, you shall be a sign for them, and they shall know that I am the Lord.
